judges: Before McCollum, C. J., Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Brown, Mestrezat and Potter, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Brown,
The questions raised on this appeal have been considered and passed upon in the case of Hood to the use of McCloskey v. Albert E. Norton et al., January term, 1901, No. 111, and, for the reasons stated in the opinion in that case, this day filed, the order of the court below is affirmed, with costs.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Brown,

casebody.head_matter:
Hood, Appellant, v. Norton.
March 24, 1902:
Argued Jan. 23, 1892.
Appeal, No. 112, Jan T., 1901, by plaintiff, from orders of C. P. No. 1, Phila. Co., June T., 1892, M. L. D. 208, making absolute rules to strike off names of terretenants and to set aside the service of scire facias on terre-tenants in case of James Hood to the use of Joseph Y. McCloskey v. Albert E. Norton, Edward Mayne or Mayer, Robert Irwin, W. B. Russell, Henry Tatnall, Adelia B. Frescolm, Jacob F. Kammerer, Amelia J. Lyle, Mary J. Robinson, John McKennon and Leon H. F. Folz.
Before McCollum, C. J., Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Brown, Mestrezat and Potter, JJ.
Affirmed.
